Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a very dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.183)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36428) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36428)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 286 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
